alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 6:07AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Warrick, east central Vanderburgh, southwestern Spencer, central Daviess and northeastern Henderson Counties through 545 AM CST... At 507 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from just east of Evansville to near Henderson. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Newburgh around 515 AM CST. Boonville and Stanley around 520 AM CST. Eureka around 525 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Rockport, Grandview and Santa Claus. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 near Mile Marker 70. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 144 and 148. Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 2 and 8. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
